div.l: And he that bett̉er schuld haue knytte the Reyne
Allas quoth Iohn Aleyn for Cristis peyne
Ley doune thi swerde and I will myn also
I is ful wight god wot as is a Roo
Bi godis hert he schall nat scape vs bath
Why ne had thou put the capill in the lathe
Yl haile Aleyn by god thou is a fonne
Thise sely Clerkis han full fast I ronne
Toward the fenne both Aleyn and eke Iohn
And when the Miller sigh that they were gon
He half a buschel of hir floure hathe take
And bad his wif go knede hit in a cake
He saide I trow the Clerkis were a ferd
Yit can a Miller make a clerkis berd
For al his arte now lat hym gon his way
Loo where he goth no lat the childryn play
They gete hym nott so lightly by my croune
Thise sely clerkꝭes rennyn vp and downe
With kepe stande gossa ware derere
So wif ga So wif Ga wightly thou and I schall kepe hym here
But schortly till that it was verrey nyght
They koude nat trewly with all hir myght
Hir Capill cache he ranne all wey so faste
Til in a diche they caught hym at laste
Wery and wete as bee is in the reyne
Comyth sely Iohn and with hym comyth Aleyn
Allas quoth Iohn the day that I was borne
Nowe are we drivyn tyl hethyn and to scorne
Oure corne is stole men wol vs foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn and oure felaus alle
And namly the Myller wellawey
Thus playnyth Iohn as he goth be the way
To warde the Mille and Baiard in his hande
The Miller sittyng by the fire he fande
For hit was nyght and ferther myght they nought
But for the loue of god they hym by sought
Of harboure and of ease for hir peny
The Miller seide a gayne if ther be any
Swiche as it is ye schul haue youre parte
My hous is straight but ye haue lernyd arte
Ye canne by Argumentꝭes makyn a place
